intro: Mananthes, commonly known as the redroot goldenweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and red-hued roots. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and grassy areas. Mananthes has lance-shaped leaves and produces daisy-like blooms that attract pollinators. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of native plant ecosystems.
